author: pdobacz
content:
Yes, as of this EOF pre-release 2.1.0, the blockchain tests have more coverage by the "`eofwrap` tests". These are coming from a subset of `ethereum/tests` state tests with legacy code wrapped to become EOF code, wherever that was possible.

More or less they call all legacy EVM opcodes in EOF contexts and check if they behave as expected (or at least do not cause smoke in the EVM). This is a stop gap solution until `ethereum/tests` are migrated over to EEST (which is ongoing)
